unnormalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Uptake Gains Momentum
normalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Uptake Gains Momentum

unnormalised: New Delhi - India is making significant strides in renewable energy adoption, driven by both environmental concerns and economic opportunities. Dr. Anil Sharma from IIT-Bombay highlights that solar power generation in Rajasthan has surpassed traditional coal-based plants on several occasions this year.
normalised: New Delhi - India is making significant strides in renewable energy adoption, driven by both environmental concerns and economic opportunities. Doctor Anil Sharma from I I T-Bombay highlights that solar power generation in Rajasthan has surpassed traditional coal-based plants on several occasions this year.

unnormalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) reports a substantial increase in solar panel installations across rural areas, especially in states like Gujarat and Tamil Nadu. Rooftop solar projects, incentivized by government subsidies, are gaining popularity among urban households. A typical installation on a 1000 sq ft roof can potentially save a household Rs. 20,000 annually.
normalised: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) reports a substantial increase in solar panel installations across rural areas, especially in states like Gujarat and Tamil Nadu. Rooftop solar projects, incentivized by government subsidies, are gaining popularity among urban households. A typical installation on a one thousand square feet roof can potentially save a household rupee twenty thousand annually.

unnormalised: Wind energy projects, particularly in the Western Ghats, are also contributing significantly. Experts believe that with continued investment and technological advancements, India can achieve its ambitious renewable energy targets and reduce its carbon footprint considerably, paving the way for a cleaner and more sustainable future for generations to come. The recent initiative to develop green hydrogen plants is expected to further boost the sector.
